wah.giovann.csvhandler

Class CSVFileFormat.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • wah.giovann.csvhandler.CSVFileFormat.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    CSVFileFormat

    public static class CSVFileFormat.Builder
extends Object
    A builder class used to construct a CSVFileFormat object.

    For example, to build an input CSVFileFormat instance that reads from a file with UTF-16 encoding, semicolon delimiters, and no header, the following code would work:

      CSVFileFormat format = new CSVFileFormat.Builder()
       .characterSetName(CSVFileFormat.UTF_16_CHARSET)
       .delimiter(CSVFileFormat.SEMICOLON_DELIMITER)
       .hasHeader(false)
       .build();

    Note that if the character set name for an input file is not specified, the CSVReader will attempt to determine it automatically.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Giovann Wah

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Builder()
      Constructs a default CSVFileFormat.Builder instance with the following default settings:
      CSVFileFormat.COMMA_DELIMITER file delimiter, CSVFileFormat.LINE_FEED_LINE_END file line end, no character set specified, leading and trailing space should be trimmed, and the input file has a header.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CSVFileFormat build()
      Creates a new CSVFileFormat instance with all of the settings of this CSVFileFormat.Builder instance.
      CSVFileFormat.Builder characterSetName(String s)
      Sets the character set name of the CSVFileFormat instance to be built.
      CSVFileFormat.Builder delimiter(char c)
      Sets the file delimiter of the CSVFileFormat instance to be built.
      CSVFileFormat.Builder hasHeader(boolean h)
      Sets a boolean value determining whether or not the input file has a header.
      CSVFileFormat.Builder outputFileLineEnd(char[] c)
      Sets the output file line end char of the CSVFileFormat instance to be built.
      CSVFileFormat.Builder trimSpace(boolean b)
      Sets a boolean value determining whether or not the input fields should have leading and trailing space trimmed.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder()
        Constructs a default CSVFileFormat.Builder instance with the following default settings:
        CSVFileFormat.COMMA_DELIMITER file delimiter, CSVFileFormat.LINE_FEED_LINE_END file line end, no character set specified, leading and trailing space should be trimmed, and the input file has a header.

    • Method Detail

      • delimiter

        public CSVFileFormat.Builder delimiter(char c)
        Sets the file delimiter of the CSVFileFormat instance to be built.
        Parameters:
        c - char to use as the delimiter.
        Returns:
        CSVFileFormat.Builder instance.

      • outputFileLineEnd

        public CSVFileFormat.Builder outputFileLineEnd(char[] c)
        Sets the output file line end char of the CSVFileFormat instance to be built. This array can consist of up to two characters in length, in one of three configurations: A line feed character, a carriage return character, or a carriage return character followed by a line feed character.
        Parameters:
        c - char array to use as the line end.
        Returns:
        CSVFileFormat.Builder instance.

      • characterSetName

        public CSVFileFormat.Builder characterSetName(String s)
        Sets the character set name of the CSVFileFormat instance to be built. Must be the canonical name of the character set. By default, the character set is null; when null, the CSVReader will attempt to determine the character set automatically.
        Parameters:
        s - String representation the character set.
        Returns:
        CSVFileFormat.Builder instance.

      • hasHeader

        public CSVFileFormat.Builder hasHeader(boolean h)
        Sets a boolean value determining whether or not the input file has a header.
        Parameters:
        h - If true, the input file has a header. Otherwise, the input file will be treated as though it doesn't.
        Returns:
        CSVFileFormat.Builder instance.

      • trimSpace

        public CSVFileFormat.Builder trimSpace(boolean b)
        Sets a boolean value determining whether or not the input fields should have leading and trailing space trimmed.
        Parameters:
        b - If true, leading and trailing space will be trimmed. Otherwise, no action will be performed.
        Returns:
        CSVFileFormat.Builder instance.

      • build

        public CSVFileFormat build()
        Creates a new CSVFileFormat instance with all of the settings of this CSVFileFormat.Builder instance.
        Returns:
        A new CSVFileFormat instance.
